article:
'Subject matter', in general, is anything which can be content for some theory.

'Subject matter' may refer to:

* Patentable subject matter (or statutory subject matter), defining whether
  patent protection is available
* Subject-matter jurisdiction, determining the kinds of claims or disputes over
  which a court has jurisdiction
* Subject-matter expert, an expert in a particular area
* Subject matter expert Turing test, a variation of the Turing test where a
  computer system attempts to replicate an expert in a given field
